text: Italy has participated in all the IAAF World Indoor Championships in Athletics since the beginning in 1985 IAAF World Indoor Games. Italy won a total of 24 medals (6 gold, 6 silver and 12 bronze). Italy is 21st on the all time medal table. ==Medal count== {| class="wikitable" width=60% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" !rowspan=2|Editions !rowspan=2|1st edition !rowspan=2|Last edition Italy at the 2016 IAAF World Indoor Championships competed from 17 to 20 March, with 5 athletes, 2 men and 3 women and won a gold medal with Gianmarco Tamberi in the high jump. ;Men (2) {| class="wikitable" width=60% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Athlete!!Event!!Date of birth!!Personal Best!!Season Best!!Result!!Performance |- |align=left|Marco Fassinotti |rowspan=2|High Jump|| 29 Apr 89 || 2.35 m|| 2.35 m||9th ||2.25 m |- |align=left|Gianmarco Tamberi | 01 Jun 92 || 2.38 m|| 2.38 m||bgcolor=gold|1st ||2.36 m |} ;Women (3) {| class="wikitable" width=60% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Athlete!!Event!!Date of birth!!Personal Best!!Season Best!!Result!!Performance |- |align=left|Gloria Hooper |60 Metres || 03 Mar 92 || 7.32 || 7.32 || ||7.28 |- |align=left|Chiara Rosa |Shot Put || 28 Jan 83 || 19.15 m|| 17.90 m||11th ||17.10 m |- |align=left|Alessia Trost |High Jump || 08 Mar 93 || 2.00 m|| 1.95 m||7th ||1.93 m |} ==2018== Italy at the 2018 IAAF World Indoor Championships competed in Birmingham from 1 to 4 March, with 13 athletes, 4 men and 9 women. ;Men (4) {| class="wikitable" width=65% style="font-size:90%; text- align:left;" |- !Event !!Athlete!!Club!!Result!!Performance!!Notes |- |Triple jump |Fabrizio Donato |G.S.
